title: (x) Leo window sign - Commercial Script {Richard, Patricia}
content:
A local controversy over the name of a soon-to-be opening business' name: "Leo" or "Lea". Looks like "Leo", but some are arguing otherwise. Any type ID welcome ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054852im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
   
 ![leao](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054852im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69352.jpg)
author: daveross

comments.content:
I'm pretty certain it is "Leo"   
   
My first thought for a font was [Palace Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/palace-script/mt-semi-bold/testdrive.html?s=Leo&p=72) but that's not quite right.   
   
I suspect it might be a rather dodgy sign software knockoff of Palace.   
   
EDIT: Correction, it seems to be a version of [Commercial Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/commercial-script/)   
   
I have a copy at work, it has the longer connector on the "a" I'll post a shot of it later.

It's Commercial Script   
   
oops too late. Seems to be the Bistream version, see [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/commercial-script/commercial-script/testdrive.html?s=Leo&p=72).   
   
And it's Leo.

Well it's closeï¿½   
 ![Leo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054852im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69365.jpg)   
and "Lea" for comparison.
